title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Govt gets investment proposal worth ₹16,000 cr under electronic component scheme
ITC to invest ₹20,000 crore in new manufacturing units in medium term: Chairman Sanjiv Puri
Dixon Technologies gets govt nod for JV with China's Longcheer
Japan seeks digital technology collaboration with India to boost manufacturing & address workforce shortage
Intel Job Cuts Amid Manufacturing Overhaul
items.summary:
- Intel plans to reduce its workforce by **15%**, cutting down to *75,000* employees by year-end. 
- CEO *Lip Bu Tan* aims for a more **cost-disciplined** approach, prioritizing economic sense in investments. 
- The company struggles with losses, forecasting a **24-cent loss per share**, exceeding analysts' expectations.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet Approves Electronics Policy
items.summary:
- The Andhra Pradesh Cabinet approved an *electronics manufacturing policy* to boost local and global investments in the sector.
- The policy offers *incentives and support measures* for electronics companies, with potential employment for over 150,000 people.
- Significant allocations of land and investment proposals are set to enhance *Visakhapatnam's capabilities* in technology and services.

items.title: Adani to Partner with MetTube for Copper Tubes Business
items.summary:
- *Adani Enterprises* will divest 50% of its copper tubes business to MetTube while acquiring an equal stake in MetTube's Indian unit.
- This partnership focuses on producing high-performance *copper tubes* for HVAC, renewable energy, and smart construction, supporting India's self-reliance.
- The collaboration aims to enhance domestic manufacturing capability, reduce imports, and align with India's *green infrastructure* goals.

items.title: India developing three types of small modular reactors: Jitendra Singh
items.summary:
- India is advancing *three types of small modular reactors (SMRs)*, including one for hydrogen production.
- The *Bharat Small Modular Reactor (BSMR)* and other units will be developed indigenously with DAE support.
- With a projected cost of about *Rs 5,750 crore*, these innovations aim for *decarbonization* and enhance nuclear power capabilities.

items.title: Magnet mayhem could halt Bajaj aug EV output
items.author: Shally Mohile, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Bajaj Auto* faces a potential shutdown in August for their electric vehicles due to a *shortage of rare earth magnets* caused by Chinese export restrictions.
- This unprecedented situation could lead to *zero production* for their Chetak scooter and GoGo three-wheeler model.
- The company urges for *government clarity* on future supply chains and possible regulatory adjustments under the *production-linked incentive* program.

items.title: EMotorad’s Dynem Exports E-Bikes to US
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- **EMotorad's Dynem** has started shipping *India-made e-bikes* to the US, targeting *B2B clients*.
- The company aims for over **20,000 annual shipments** from its Giga Factory, expecting around *$10 million* in recurring revenue.
- Dynem positions itself as a key *OEM* supplier to leading US e-bike brands while also introducing *EMotorad-branded products*.

items.title: India-UK Trade Deal Lowers Tariffs for JLR
items.summary:
- The **India-UK free trade agreement** will reduce automotive tariffs from *110% to 10%*, benefiting Jaguar Land Rover (JLR).
- JLR's spokesperson emphasized the deal's importance for accessing the *Indian luxury car market* and potential future growth.
- The trade pact eliminates tariffs on 99% of goods from India to the UK and facilitates easier travel for Indian workers.

items.title: Tata Group to focus on chips, digital platforms, EVs: Chandrasekaran
items.summary:
- Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran emphasized the *importance of semiconductors*, *electric vehicles*, and *digital platforms* for the Tata Group's growth.  
- The group is advancing in semiconductor manufacturing and aims for significant advancements in *battery capacity* and renewable energy.  
- The Tata Group has seen substantial financial growth, with revenues increasing by 1.9 times over five years and plans for an *initial public offering* in the near future.

items.title: Ministry of Steel to hold open house on steel import procedures
Bikaji Foods Forms Joint Venture with Nepal’s Chaudhary Group
items.summary:
- *Bikaji Foods* has entered a **50:50 joint venture** with *Chaudhary Group* for its international expansion in Nepal.
- The venture focuses on *manufacturing, trading, and marketing* their snack portfolio to enhance the food ecosystem.
- This partnership aims to create *employment opportunities* and strengthen supply chains within Nepal.

items.title: India–UK CETA Boosting Auto Industry
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- The India–UK CETA provides *tariff-free access* for 99% of Indian exports, boosting the auto industry.
- It enables *smoother mobility* for Indian professionals, facilitating competitive edge and partnerships.
- Expected to double bilateral trade by 2030, the auto sector is pivotal for India's *global ambitions* in electric mobility and sustainability.

items.title: India-UK FTA: Zero duty to boost India's generic drug exports
items.summary:
- The **UK** has agreed to **zero duty** on Indian **generic medicines** and **medical devices** under a new trade agreement.
- This move is expected to enhance the **competitiveness** of Indian products in the UK market, significantly benefiting the **pharmaceutical sector**.
- India's exports to the UK currently stand at **under $1 billion**, presenting substantial growth potential in a market expected to exceed **$30 billion**.

items.title: Torrent likely in talks to buy L&T’s power unit for $1 bn
items.summary:
- *Torrent Power Ltd.* is negotiating to acquire L&T's thermal business for about **$1 billion**. 
- The sale could assist L&T in reducing its debt while focusing on its primary engineering business. 
- Talks are ongoing, and the outcome may change with the possibility of other bidders entering the fray.

items.title: 'Key strategic ally': Top Israeli defence official hails India
items.summary:
- **India** is recognized as Israel's key *strategic ally* and has shown resilience through challenges.
- Recent meetings emphasized *defence cooperation*, focusing on *research and development* and *joint manufacturing initiatives*.
- The visit by Maj Gen Amir Baram represents a significant step in enhancing *India-Israel defence relations*.

items.title: AB Cotspin India to invest ₹1,500 crore to expand manufacturing capacity
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- AB Cotspin India plans to invest *₹1,500 crore* to expand its manufacturing capacity over the next three years.
- The company aims to add approximately *200,000 spindles* to enhance production across multiple locations, including *Madhya Pradesh*.
- The expansion focuses on *sustainable manufacturing* and renewable energy, aiming to meet *growing demand* for quality cotton yarn and eco-friendly products.

items.title: Chinese PCBs Still Cheaper than Indian
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
* **Cost competitiveness**: Chinese PCBs remain *cheaper* than Indian ones despite a 30% anti-dumping duty.
* **R&D Investment**: Abhishek Malik highlights the need for *greater investment* in domestic R&D to advance India's manufacturing capabilities.
* **Manufacturing Direction**: The *shift* towards design-led manufacturing is progressing slowly, emphasizing the necessity for true partnerships across industry and policy.

items.title: Make in India: Plan to List Key Transmission Gear
items.summary:
- The Indian government aims to *indigenize* critical power transmission equipment, particularly for *high-voltage direct current* lines.
- Stakeholder discussions will involve industry associations and entities like the *Power Grid Corporation of India* to identify key equipment for local manufacturing.
- A potential *production-linked incentive scheme* is being explored to enhance the local supply chain and support clean tech manufacturing.

items.title: Over 50 SMEs propose to invest ₹100 crore in Maheshwar
items.summary:
- Over *50 small and medium enterprises* plan to invest around ₹*100 crore* in the Maheshwar industrial area.
- The MSME department has allocated *55 plots* for various industries, including food processing and manufacturing.
- Due to high demand, a *second phase* of development for the industrial belt is planned on an additional 30 hectares.

items.title: Goa's solar industry set for ₹325 crore turnover by 2027: SPAG
items.summary:
- Goa's solar industry aims for a turnover of **₹325 crore** by 2027.
- The total installed solar capacity is projected to grow from **12 MW** to **65 MW**.
- Job creation in the sector is expected to increase significantly, reaching **8,250** jobs by 2027.

items.title: PVC pipes, fittings manufacturing companies to see recovery this fiscal: Crisil Ratings
items.summary:
- PVC pipes and fittings manufacturing companies are expected to see a recovery this fiscal year due to *robust demand* from end-user segments.
- Government initiatives like the *Jal Jeevan Mission* and increased budget allocations are driving demand in water supply and housing segments.
- Improved profitability and lower inventory levels will allow manufacturers to expand capacities without heavy financial strain.

items.title: Denso to invest ₹250 crore in new EV component plant in UP
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Denso Corporation will invest ₹250 crore to build a *motor generator* manufacturing facility in *Gautam Budh Nagar*, Uttar Pradesh.
- This investment aims to enhance *India's electric and hybrid vehicle ecosystem* and promote *cleaner mobility solutions*.
- The announcement follows a strategic meeting during the *World Expo 2025* in Osaka, emphasizing *industrial collaboration* and *technology transfer*.

items.title: Godrej Aerospace signs manufacturing contract with Pratt & Whitney
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Godrej Aerospace has signed a contract with *Pratt & Whitney* for the production of aircraft engine components.
- This agreement aims to enhance Godrej's technological capabilities and align with its goal to be a key supplier in *global aerospace manufacturing*.
- The expansion of their manufacturing space supports India's growing role in *high-precision engineering* and aerospace supply chains.

items.title: India's Private Sector Growth Amid Inflation Concerns
items.summary:
- India's private sector growth remains strong, driven by *manufacturing* and international demand.
- However, rising *inflation* and weakening job creation have tempered optimism, reflected by declining business confidence.
- The latest PMI reading indicates sustained expansion, but concerns over employment and pricing pressures persist.

items.title: India's Flash PMI Reaches 60.7 in July
items.summary:
- The HSBC Flash India Composite PMI rose to *60.7* in July, indicating strong *private sector growth*. 
- The manufacturing sector led the growth, with a PMI of *59.2*, marking its highest level in nearly *17.5 years*. 
- Despite inflationary pressures impacting input costs, *business optimism* for future growth remains high.

items.title: India-UK FTA: PM Modi, Starmer to sign historic deal
items.summary:
- The India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) aims to boost *bilateral trade* by approximately **$34 billion annually**.
- Prime Ministers Modi and Starmer will introduce a comprehensive *UK-India Vision 2035*, enhancing cooperation beyond trade.
- The FTA will benefit consumers through lower *tariffs*, decreasing from 15% to 3% on various goods.

items.title: JSW Energy Signs Pact for Solar Project with BESCOM
items.summary:
- JSW Renew Energy has signed a *25-year power purchase agreement* with BESCOM for a *100 MW solar project*.
- The project will feature *100 MWh of battery storage* and connect to KPTCL Firozabad substation.
- This agreement increases JSW's total energy storage capacity to *29.4 GWh*, aiming for *40 GWh by 2030*.

items.title: Godrej Enterprises Group's aerospace business inks pact with Pratt & Whitney
Trump recommends location verification for AI chips
items.summary:
- The Trump administration proposed **export controls** for advanced AI chips, ensuring their location verification.  
- This move aims to enhance security and prevent such technology from reaching **adversarial nations** like China.  
- Bipartisan lawmakers have expressed support, emphasizing alignment with the **Chip Security Act**.

items.title: Clean tech exports hit ₹54,000 crore; green jobs projected to touch 35 million by 2047
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- India's *clean energy economy* created over **5.1 million jobs** by FY23, a significant increase from 2017-18.  
- Clean energy exports reached **₹54,000 crore**, driven by solar and electric vehicle sectors.  
- Future projections suggest *green employment could rise to 35 million* by 2047 with appropriate investments and policy support.

items.title: Lynas Rare Earths Q4 revenue beats estimates by 10%, agrees magnet deal
items.summary:
- Lynas Rare Earths reported a **10% increase** in Q4 revenue, totaling A$170.2 million. 
- The company entered a **magnet manufacturing deal** with JS Link in South Korea, aiming to develop a sustainable supply chain. 
- Lynas's increased **rare earth oxide output** rose to 3,212 metric tons, supported by growing market demand and higher selling prices.

items.title: India's Sports Market Growth Forecast
items.summary:
- India's sports market is set to experience a *10-12% CAGR* by 2030, driven by government initiatives and increased fitness awareness.
- Current market value is approximately *$52 billion*, with *exports expected to reach $660 million by FY26*.
- The sector's growth is bolstered by strong manufacturing hubs and connections to industries like media and tourism, enhancing overall economic impact.

items.title: India's Mobile Manufacturing Surge: CDS Study Insights
items.summary:
- India has risen to become the *3rd-largest* exporter of mobile phones, with exports projected at **USD 24.1 billion** by 2024-25.
- The sector's growth is driven by significant *government support* and integration into *global value chains* since 2017.
- The study highlights a *113% increase* in domestic value addition, indicating a maturing manufacturing ecosystem focused on exports.

items.title: India's Rare Earth Oxide Resources and Self-Sufficiency
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- India possesses *8.52 million tonnes* of rare earth oxide resources across various states, focusing on securing *supply chains for critical minerals*.
- The country has not imported rare earth minerals in the last 10 years, while exports have been limited to *18 tonnes*.
- The *National Critical Mineral Mission* aims to bolster the domestic critical minerals sector with an investment plan totaling ₹16,300 crore.

items.title: Auto manufacturing emissions in India can drop 87% by 2050
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- India's auto industry can potentially cut *manufacturing-related carbon emissions* by up to **87% by 2050** through green energy and low-carbon steel adoption.
- Achieving this requires using 100% clean electricity and shifting to hydrogen-based energy in steel production.
- A strategic focus on *electrifying vehicles* and decarbonizing manufacturing processes is essential for aligning with *net-zero targets*.

items.title: Vedanta declared as 'preferred bidder' for iron ore mining in Karnataka
items.summary:
- *Vedanta Ltd.* has been designated as the **'preferred bidder'** for the Janthakal Iron Ore Mine in Karnataka by the government.  
- This decision was officially announced on **July 22, 2025**, following a competitive auction process.  
- The mine, covering an area of **71.16 hectares**, is at the preliminary exploration stage and requires further regulatory approvals before the license can be granted.

items.title: USFDA pulls up Glenmark for manufacturing lapses
items.summary:
- The **USFDA** issued a warning letter citing *manufacturing lapses* at Glenmark's Pithampur plant.  
- Violations included inadequate *laboratory controls* and failure to follow proper testing protocols.  
- Similar **CGMP violations** have been noted at other Glenmark facilities, indicating a broader issue with *management oversight*.

items.title: Eureka Forbes & Dixon Technologies: Robotic Vacuums
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
* Eureka Forbes partners with **Dixon Technologies** to manufacture *robotic vacuum cleaners* in India.  
* The collaboration aims to boost *domestic production* and leverage Dixon's expertise in consumer electronics.  
* This partnership is poised to enhance Eureka Forbes' presence in the emerging robotic vacuum market.

items.title: Renault's India Expansion: More SUVs and Exports
items.summary:
* Renault is set to expand its lineup in India by introducing more **SUVs** and enhancing exports.  
* With a **$600 million** investment, the company aims to recover market share in India's competitive automotive sector.  
* Currently, Renault's factory operates at **50% capacity**, and the goal is to increase this to between **80% and 100%** by leveraging SUV popularity and exploring new markets.

items.title: 6 Chip Manufacturing Projects Approved
items.summary:
- The Indian government has approved *six semiconductor manufacturing projects* with a total investment of approximately *Rs 1,55,000 crore*.
- These projects are expected to create **over 27,000 direct jobs**, fostering skilled employment in the semiconductor sector.
- The initiatives include the *Semicon India Programme* and the *C2S programme*, aimed at developing skilled manpower and infrastructure in the industry.

items.title: Trump's Tariff Deals Reshape Global Manufacturing
items.summary:
- President **Trump's** new tariffs on Japanese imports are set at **15%**, focusing on autos, a key trade deficit area.
- Tariff agreements with **Philippines** and **Indonesia** are in place, hinting at a regional consensus at around **19%**.
- These deals bring *clarity* after uncertainty, though further negotiations with **China** and other economies are ongoing.

items.title: Inox Wind secures 51 MW order from Thermax Group firm for Tamil Nadu project
items.summary:
- *Inox Wind Limited* has secured a **51 MW order** from *First Energy Private Limited*, a subsidiary of *Thermax Group*, for wind turbine generators in Tamil Nadu.
- This order is the first for Inox's 3 MW class wind turbines, highlighting a significant step in *India's energy transition goals*.
- The project includes not only the supply of turbines but also *EPC services*, showcasing Inox Wind's commitment to renewable energy projects.

items.title: India emerges as a global mobile manufacturing powerhouse, says CDS study
Vena Energy signs India’s first load-following PPA
items.summary:
- Vena Energy has signed a *100 MW load-following Power Purchase Agreement* (PPA) with SECI, marking India's first under the FDRE scheme.
- This innovative agreement requires renewable energy developers to align their supply with *hourly demand profiles*, utilizing wind, solar, and storage systems.
- The project aims to generate enough energy to power approximately *487,000 households*, while significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions and conserving water resources.

items.title: Manufacturing opportunity immense but window finite: JBM's Nishant Arya
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
JBM's Nishant Arya highlights significant opportunities for India in **global manufacturing** and **EVs**:
- India’s trajectory toward becoming a manufacturing powerhouse is driven by *skilling*, *technology convergence*, and *design-led innovation*.
- The country's manufacturing contributes about **17%** to GDP, with government initiatives aiming to boost this to **25%**, leveraging sectors like *automotive* and *battery technology*.
- Arya emphasizes the need for a *unified ecosystem* in EV manufacturing and continuous *skilling* of the workforce to maintain competitiveness.

items.title: Inox Wind Secures 51 MW Contract from First Energy
items.summary:
- Inox Wind has received a significant *51 MW order* from **First Energy Pvt Ltd**, a part of the *Thermax Group*. 
- The project involves the supply of *3 MW class wind turbines* in Tamil Nadu, with additional *EPC and maintenance services* included. 
- This collaboration aims to advance *India's energy transition goals* and enhance renewable energy solutions.

items.title: India’s semiconductor strategy shifts gears to execution
